metadata.title: Sample Custom Security Control Catalog
metadata.remarks: This is a sample catalog demonstrating OSCAL catalog structure. It includes example controls for access control and audit logging.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ insert: param, ac-1_prm_1 }} an access control policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and compliance.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Review and update the access control policy {{ insert: param, ac-1_prm_2 }}.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Access control policy can be included as part of the general security policy or be represented by multiple policies. Procedures can be documented in system security plans or in one or more separate documents.

guidelines.prose: Specify the personnel or roles responsible for developing and maintaining access control policy.
Specify how often to review the policy (e.g., annually).

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Define and document the types of accounts allowed and specifically prohibited for use within the system.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Assign account managers for {{ insert: param, ac-2_prm_1 }}.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Review accounts for compliance {{ insert: param, ac-2_prm_2 }}.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Account management includes the identification of account types, establishing conditions for group membership, and assigning associated authorizations.

guidelines.prose: Specify account types requiring special management (e.g., privileged, shared, service accounts).
Specify the review frequency for accounts.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Employ automated mechanisms to support the management of system accounts.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Automated account management reduces administrative overhead and improves consistency in applying account policies.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ insert: param, au-1_prm_1 }} an audit and accountability policy.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Review and update the policy {{ insert: param, au-1_prm_2 }}.

controls.title: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging in support of the audit function.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Coordinate the event logging function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information.

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Specify {{ insert: param, au-2_prm_1 }} for logging within the system.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Event logging requirements can be derived from applicable laws, regulations, policies, and organizational needs. Organizations should consider what events are needed to support investigations.

guidelines.prose: Specify event types to log (e.g., authentication events, privilege escalation, data access).

citation.text: Joint Task Force. Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organizations. NIST Special Publication 800-53, Revision 5. September 2020.
NIST. Assessing Security and Privacy Controls in Information Systems and Organizations. NIST Special Publication 800-53A, Revision 5. January 2022.
